html.p: If this is your first time using this app, please follow this link to the app setup instructions to properly configure your system to accept data.

The purpose of this app is to help provide operational intelligence and insight into your Extreme Networks infrastructure. Our goal is to establish a framework with which you can easily monitor for potential issues occurring on your network.

Using this app, you will be able to, at a glance, see all of your Extreme Networks hardware, software, version information, and enabled features. You will also see information on the health of your network - important log messages, hardware warnings, and potential memory and CPU problem states.
With this information in hand, you will be able to quickly track down the source of network issues and see swifter resolution with the help of our Technical Assistance Center.
In order to receive the maximum benefit of this app, Extreme Networks devices need to be running EXOS v15.4 or higher with proactive tech support functionality enabled.
This is an ongoing development project at Extreme Networks, with many planned enhancements, upgrades, and new features.
If you have questions, comments, concerns, feature requests, or bug reports, please direct them to splunk@extremenetworks.com.

Note: for detailed instructions on how to configure your Extreme Networks devices to work with this app, look in the Documents menu on the navigation bar, under EXOS Requirements and Configuration for Using the Splunk App

All of the information contained in these dashboards is historic rather than real-time. The frequency at which you set the tech-support collector to push data to Splunk will impact how near to real-time the resulting dashboards are reliable.
